PLP104.name: Applied Plant Pathology for Ornamentals and Turf
PLP104.description: Diseases of woody ornamentals and turf grasses.
PLP104.restrictions: Open to agricultural technology students in the College of Agriculture and Natural Resources.

PLP105.name: Fundamentals of Applied Plant Pathology
PLP105.description: Diseases of major agronomic and horticultural plants. Disease management. Offered first ten weeks of the semester.
PLP105.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

PLP200.name: Plant Diseases and Their Pathogens
PLP200.description: Plant diseases. Biology of pathogens that cause disease. Disease management, with focus on Northern Michigan.
PLP200.restrictions: Open to agricultural technology students in the College of Agriculture and Natural Resources.

PLP266.name: Turf Pathology
PLP266.description: Turf pathogens and turf diseases. Cultural, biological and chemical methods for turf disease management.

PLP402.name: Biology of Fungi
PLP402.description: Characteristics, habitats, and diversity of major groups of fungi. Ecologic and economic importance of fungi.
PLP402.prerequisite: BS 162 or BS 161 or PLB 105 or LB 144 or LB 145 or BS 182H or BS 181H

PLP405.name: Plant Pathology
PLP405.description: Plant diseases and the organisms that cause them. Principles of disease management including application of chemicals, plant breeding, biological control, and genetic engineering.
PLP405.prerequisite: ((BS 161 and BS 162) and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or ((PLB 105 and PLB 106) and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or ((LB 144 and LB 145) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)

PLP407.name: Diseases and Insects of Forest and Shade Trees
PLP407.description: Diseases, insects, and environmental problems affecting trees in forests, parks, suburbs, and nurseries. Methods of control.
PLP407.prerequisite: (PLB 105 or BS 162 or LB 144) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

PLP490.name: Independent Study
PLP490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PLP490.description: Independent study of plant pathology on a laboratory, field or library research program of special interest to the student.

PLP491.name: Selected Topics in Plant Pathology
PLP491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PLP491.description: Selected topics in plant pathology of current interest and importance.

PLP492.name: Seminar
PLP492.description: Capstone course. Experience in scientific writing, oral presentations, professional preparation, and current developments in plant pathology.
PLP492.prerequisite: (PLP 498) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

PLP493.name: Professional Internship in Plant Pathology
PLP493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PLP493.description: Supervised professional experiences in agencies and businesses related to plant pathology.
PLP493.restrictions: Approval of department; application required. A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits for any or all of these courses

PLP498.name: Undergraduate Research
PLP498.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PLP498.description: Faculty supervised laboratory. Field research in plant pathology.
PLP498.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.

PLP805.name: Principals in Plant Pathology
PLP805.description: Biodiversity of plant pathogens, molecular plant microbe interactions, microbial ecology, epidemiology, and population genetics of plant pathogens.

PLP812.name: Epidemiology of Plant Diseases
PLP812.description: Populations of plant pathogens within populations of plant hosts as affected by the environment and humans.

PLP820.name: Plant Reproductive Biology and Polyploidy
PLP820.description: Genetic processes underlying variations in plant reproductive biology and polyploidy. Utilization of these characteristics in plant breeding.

PLP847.name: Advanced Mycology
PLP847.description: Systematics, identification, physiology, genetics, and molecular biology of plant pathogenic fungi.

PLP881.name: Molecular and Biochemical Plant Pathology (Interim Change)
PLP881.description: Biochemical and molecular bases of host-pathogen interactions. Mechanisms of pathogenicity and the nature of disease resistance.

PLP884.name: Prokaryotic Diseases of Plants
PLP884.description: Prokaryotic genera associated with plant diseases. Genetics and host-pathogen interactions. Prokaryotic disease control strategies.

PLP885.name: Plant Diseases in the Field
PLP885.description: Diagnosis of plant diseases and disorders in a field setting. Field trips and independent study required.

PLP890.name: Independent Study
PLP890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PLP890.description: Individual study in laboratory, field or library research in plant pathology

PLP893.name: Selected Topics
PLP893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of odd years

PLP894.name: Seminar in Plant Pathology
PLP894.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PLP894.description: Review, organization, analysis and oral presentation of research.

PLP899.name: Master's Thesis Research
PLP899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

PLP999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
PLP999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
